sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews now. I'm Helena Humphrey and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The war effort in Ukraine was front and center of EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's State of the Union address in Strasbourg.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy vows that normal life will return to recently liberated areas as soon as possible after a stunning counter-offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the coffin carrying Queen Elizabeth II returns for a final night at Buckingham Palace before lying in state ahead of next week's funeral at Westminster Abbey in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Wearing blue and yellow, the war in Ukraine was front and centre of EU Commission President

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen's State of the Union address this morning in Strasbourg.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Von der Leyen and guest of honor Olena Zelenska, the first lady of Ukraine, were welcomed by EU Parliament President Roberta Metsola.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Von der Leyen stressed European support for Kyiv would continue. This is not only a war unleashed by Russia against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is also a war on our energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a war on our economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a war on our values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is a war on our future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is about autocracy against democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And I stand here with a conviction that with the necessary courage and with the necessary solidarity, Putin will fail and Ukraine and Europe will prevail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Zelensky was applauded by MEPs ahead of the address as von der Leyen vowed that sanctions on Russia, which she said had left its economy in tatters, would continue as it was time for resolve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: These are the remnants of Russia's occupation of northeast Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tanks and other vehicles abandoned after its forces made a seemingly hasty retreat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's military is now consolidating its gains made during its lightning-fast counter-offensive over recent days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It says it has reclaimed over 300 settlements in the Kharkiv region, raising the yellow and blue flag in places controlled by Moscow-backed forces for the past six months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that stabilization measures were being carried out in over 4,000 square kilometers of liberated territory and that normal life, such as the payment of pensions, would return as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But some people in Ukraine's liberated towns say they are still bearing the scars of Russian rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Police are investigating claims that civilians had been tortured and shot by Russian soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow-backed forces are continuing to hit civilian infrastructure facilities throughout eastern and southern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia says it's carrying out massive strikes on Ukraine's front line after it had to pull back troops in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The territorial shifts mark one of Russia's biggest setbacks since the start of the war, but the Kremlin appears no closer to a negotiated peace deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: is no closer to a negotiated peace deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a sight that's grown familiar in the last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian flags being raised in formerly occupied territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the advance isn't over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: At least according to the country's former president, Petro Poroshenko.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is more than 3,000 square kilometres and the impulse is not finished yet, despite of the fact that Putin tried to collect as soon as possible the reserve and bring them from Russian territory to the border of Donetsk and Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And Poroshenko is confident that Europe will not stop its support for Ukraine, despite gas cuts from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Western people start to understand that this is not an assistance for Ukraine. This is an investment of every single European member state in their own security. Because if we do not stop Putin here in Ukraine, tomorrow Putin appeared in their own country. For the former president, Europe cannot be safe as long as Russian President Vladimir Putin stays in power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We definitely need to make Europe and the world safer, to deputise Europe, to deputise the world and to deputise Russia. The world will not be safe with Putin and it may be safer without him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Carcasses of tanks now litter the street in the wake of Kyiv's advances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Markers that some analysts say could be a turning street in the wake of Kyiv's advances. Markers that some analysts say could be a turning point in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Queen's coffin arrived at Buckingham Palace on a rainy London evening, having left the sunshine of Scotland behind. It's said to have been her least favourite residence, but she won't be there for long. At precisely 14.22 UK time, a procession including the King and members of the Royal Family will set off for Westminster Hall to arrive there at 1500 hours. After a short service, the Queen will lie in state there for four full days. Earlier, the Princess Royal had accompanied the coffin from Edinburgh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Princess Anne has been by her mother's side since her death and on Tuesday released a heartfelt statement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I was fortunate, she wrote, to share the last 24 hours of my dearest mother's life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's been an honour and a privilege to accompany her on her final journeys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Witnessing the love and respect shown by so many on these journeys has been both humbling and uplifting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: King Charles and Camilla, the Queen Consort, who are now in London, earlier visited Northern Ireland as part of a tour of the UK as the new monarch. They met political leaders, attended a service at St Anne's Cathedral and greeted crowds. I'm very proud that I'm here today and hopefully we can see King Charles move the Northern Ireland question forward and achieve a situation where we can have peace in these islands for future generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I got to shake his hand and I was able to pass him on a scarf from the Northern Ireland Scout Association and I'm just quite thankful to have walked on to the next person.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's very friendly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: London is now bracing for hundreds of thousands of visitors over the next few days, culminating in Monday's state funeral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Having been flown back from the Scottish capital, Edinburgh,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: last night by the Royal Air Force, Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II's coffin drove through London for a final night at Buckingham Palace, a place where she has spent so much of her working life. Later on today though she will leave it for the final time and there will be a procession through the streets of London, down the Mall, through Horse Guards Parade where of course she did the Trooping of the Colour every year, along Whitehall, past Downing Street, and to the Palace of Westminster, where the House of Commons and the House of Lords is. Part of that building is Westminster Hall. It dates back over 900 years, the time of the Norman invasion. It's the oldest part of the palace itself, and it has played host to many events through the years. It was originally the original site of the British itself and it has played host to many events through the years. It was originally this original site of the British justice system, there were courts in there but there's also a banquet hall used by the likes of Henry VIII and it's been used for the banquets of coronations and monarchs ever since but also for their lying in states. Indeed the Queen's own father George VI and her mother Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother lay in state in the hall and many of the previous monarchs did as well and so what will happen is the Queen will be placed in the centre of that hall on a platform the coffin will have the royal standard put on top as well as the orb and sceptre and crown as well and then we will expect the queuing which has already started will start to move into the hall now people are being told to prepare for a long queue upwards perhaps of 15 hours on a course that stretches back through London about five or six miles. They're being told to come dressed formally to only bring a very small bag and to be prepared for that long wait. Once they do get to the hall then they will go through airport style security and they will be able to pay their final respects. They're being told they were not allowed to do any photography or filming, use mobile phones or any handheld devices, that it has to be at all times respectful.
